intro: Lyciodes myrsinifolium, commonly known as the red-flowered morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant red or purple flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It typically grows as a climbing vine with hairy stems and small, oval leaves. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
